sub_title: Global Business Development Director - SBM Offshore | Energy affordability and sustainability at the core of everything we do
summary:
SKILLS AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES 
	
•	Ability to manage and develop people, with experience in setting-up and managing lean and highly-specialized teams, as well as general management for larger corporations; experience of managing a country office with a team of 1,500+ personnel. Accustomed to working in multinationals with matrix organizations. Currently managing a global team distributed across all continents.

•	Expertise in the ENERGY industry; solid Oil & Gas and Renewables backgroung, having worked and obtained enriching experiences in Shipyards (Maua-Jurong and BRASA Shipyards), Refinery (REDUC), fabrication factories (EBSE and ES3), EPC Contractors and Offshore FPSO Operators (SBM Offshore, and OPS - SBM + SONANGOL joint venture), building up extensive market knowledge and wide-reaching network with major EPC contractors, oil and renewables majors and government agencies. Currently riding the Energy Transition journey, having spent a couple of years now helping develop the Energy Transition side of the business, especially around Renewables Energy.

•	Good oral and written communication skills. Creating new relationships and making public presentations being second nature. Extensive experience in commercial and intra-business negotiations.

•	Capacity for adaptation and negotiation. Having lived in five different continents (motherland Brazil, Singapore - 5 years, Australia - 5 years, Angola - 2 years, currently in the Netherlands) with very peculiar cultures and societies; good handling of complex situations with professionalism, diplomacy and pragmatism. 

•	Been through different experiences and roles related to Fabrication, Construction, Offshore Production and Quality Control, allowing to attain technical knowledge in various fields of Mechanical Engineering, related to equipment such as Skids / Process Modules, Pressure Vessels, Process Towers and Piping, as well as Offshore Oil Production Operations, which has often shown to be a decisive factor during commercial negotiations and technical discussions with clients.

•	Awarded by the Golden Key Honor Society with the Outstanding Academic Achievement Certification – issued to university students, recognizing them as part of the top 15% in Australia.

•	Highly motivated and proactive, always striving to deliver more than requested. Seeking professional and personal growth, whilst keeping humility as a core value, feet-on-the-ground and serving leadership as genuine traits.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 15503, 'name': 'SBM Offshore', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHU_y0s5H5HWg/company-logo_400_400/0/1676540255175?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=pXs3JxAk4oJlElzuOOVLOf5TflOwTt7wPwzq4VYNLFo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/sbmoffshore/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'SBM Offshore', 'description': 'The Group Business Development Director is a Global Sales position which is responsible for the overall management of the Business Development department, reporting directly to SBM Offshore´s CEO 

Key responsibilities include: 

• Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions; consequently being recognized as a trusted advisor for our Clients

• Promoting and explaining Clients’ interest and drivers within SBM 

• Being an internal source for comprehensive knowledge and intelligence about our global clients and countries of focus 

• In the event of a project award, maintain a feedback loop communication with the Client, during the Execution phase 

• Facilitate engagement and proactively coordinate information-gathering activities at many levels between SBM and assigned Client/Country, through effective zippering, in order to increase Client’s penetration 

• Identify, build and lead the Key Account support teams across the entire SBM organization (functionally and globally), driving Key Account Management from a holistic global perspective

• Ensure that the Company’s Compliance and Business ethics policies are understood, implemented and audited

• Corporate Development and M&A opportunities', 'title': 'Group Business Development Director', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Rio de Janeiro Area, Brazil', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'SBM Offshore', 'description': 'SBM Brasil is a subsidiary of SBM Offshore, managing locally 07 FPSOs under offshore operations, plus three under construction, employing over 1,700 workers in Brazil and producing in excess of 25% of the overall oil throughput of Brazil

•	Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions

•	Reports to the Group COO and oversees the local Functions, including Projects, Business Development, Business Acquisition, Finance, Technology, Human Resources, Legal, Compliance and IT

•	Closely monitoring financial performance of the assets

•	Maintaining effective manning strategies, playing an active role in career development and progression of assigned staff.', 'title': 'Country Director - BRAZIL', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Luanda, Angola', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'SBM Offshore', 'description': 'OPS Serviço de Produçao de Petroleos

OPS is a SBM Offshore and SONANGOL Joint-venture

•	Responsible for all matters relating to safe and efficient operation of assigned FPSO´s and associated Shorebase - SBM´s second largest market worldwide 

•	Reports to the Supervisory Board comprised of representatives from SBM Offshore and SONANGOL

•	General management of the headquarters in Luanda, in addition to 03 FPSO´s offshore Angola (Saxi and Mondo for EXXON and Ngoma for ENI), with a total of 550 employees, ensuring safe, efficient and profitable operations in compliance with the company Management System, procedures and contractual obligations

•	Ensuring effective HSSE processes are in place and implemented, demonstrating active leadership in implementing strong HSSE culture.

•	Closely monitoring financial performance of assigned units, ensuring that contracts revenues are maximized and operating costs are correctly controlled; optimizing operating costs while ensuring that acceptable safety and integrity levels are maintained.

•	Maintaining effective manning strategy for assigned Unit, ensuring that vessels and shorebase remain crewed with an adequate number of competent personnel, whilst respecting nationalization obligations and ramp-up requirements for projects, playing an active role in career development and progression of assigned staff.

•	Management of specialized local Sales Team and interface with technical proposals team in Europe´s Headquarters

•	Management of pipeline of  prospects and opportunities in the Brazilian market

•	Market intelligence in relation to  SBM, competitors, and clients

•	Coordination of Rio Office resources/capacity  planning with regard to Rio Office proposal 
activities for SBM and BRASA Shipyard in coordination with the local Management Team

•	Responsible for the Local Content Department

ES3 is a joint-venture between brazilian fabrication leader EBSE and american conglomerate CB&I (formely SHAW Group)

•	Executive management of the headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, with a total of 200 employees, including Engineers, Technicians, Welders, Fitters and Metallurgist, reporting directly to the Executive and Production Directors.

•	EBSE’s representative in the negotiation and subsequent implementation process (start-up) of the Joint-Venture with SHAW, an American company specializing in Engineering and Manufacturing, with a turnover of around US$ 9bi in 2010, and 48,000 employees around the World
